get_real_time_weather.description: Get real-time weather information for a specific city or country. Returns current temperature, weather conditions, humidity, wind speed, pressure, visibility, and cloud coverage. Uses OpenWeatherMap API (if API key available) or wttr.in as fallback.

inputs.location: string – required – City name or country name (e.g., 'New York', 'London', 'Lebanon', 'Tokyo'). Can be in any format, the tool will attempt to find the location.

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error, if any
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error (API_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.pressure: number – atmospheric pressure in hPa or mbar

convert_currencies.description: Convert currency from one currency code to another. Supports all major currencies (USD, EUR, GBP, JPY, CAD, AUD, etc.). Uses real-time exchange rates from exchangerate-api.com. Free API, no key required.

inputs.from_currency: string – required – Source currency code in ISO 4217 format (e.g., 'USD', 'EUR', 'GBP', 'JPY', 'CAD', 'AUD', 'CHF', 'CNY', 'INR', 'AED', 'SAR', 'QAR', 'LBP')
inputs.to_currency: string – required – Target currency code in ISO 4217 format (e.g., 'USD', 'EUR', 'GBP', 'JPY')
inputs.amount: number – optional – Amount to convert (default: 1.0). Can be any positive number.

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error, if any
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error (INVALID_CURRENCY, API_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.converted_amount: number – converted amount (rounded to 2 decimal places)
outputs.exchange_rate: number – exchange rate used (rounded to 6 decimal places)
outputs.rate_date: string – date of the exchange rate
outputs.base_currency: string – base currency used for rates

examples.title: Get exchange rate for USD to JPY

get_real_time_date_time.description: Get real-time date and time for a specific country or city. Returns current date, time, timezone information, day of week, and UTC offset. Uses WorldTimeAPI (free, no key required). Supports major cities and countries worldwide.

inputs.location: string – required – Country name or city name (e.g., 'New York', 'London', 'Japan', 'Lebanon', 'Tokyo', 'Dubai'). Can be major city names or country names. The tool will attempt to determine the appropriate timezone.

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error, if any
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error (INVALID_LOCATION, API_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.date: string – current date in YYYY-MM-DD format
outputs.time: string – current time in HH:MM:SS format (24-hour)
outputs.datetime: string – combined date and time in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

examples.title: Get current time in New York
Get current time in a country

get_esim_bundles.description: Get available eSIM bundles for a specific country from esimradar.com. Returns a list of eSIM plans with provider names, data plans, validity periods, prices, and purchase links. Useful for travelers who need mobile data when visiting a country.

inputs.country: string – required – Country name (e.g., 'Qatar', 'USA', 'UAE', 'Lebanon', 'Japan', 'UK', 'France', 'Germany'). Can be full country name or common abbreviation.

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error, if any
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error (INVALID_COUNTRY, HTTP_ERROR, PARSING_ERROR, NO_BUNDLES, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.bundles: array – list of eSIM bundles, each containing: provider (string), plan (string), validity (string), price (string), link (string)
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

get_holidays.description: Get holidays for a specific country, optionally filtered by year, month, or day. Returns a list of holidays with their names, dates, types (e.g., National holiday, Observance), descriptions, and locations. Uses Calendarific API which supports 230+ countries. Requires CALENDARIFIC_API_KEY in .env file (free tier: 1,000 requests/month).

inputs.country: string – required – Country name or ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (e.g., 'USA', 'United States', 'US', 'Qatar', 'QA', 'Lebanon', 'LB', 'Japan', 'JP'). Supports common country names and abbreviations.
inputs.year: number – optional – Year to get holidays for (default: current year). Must be between 2000 and 2100.
inputs.month: number – optional – Month (1-12) to filter holidays. If provided, only holidays in that month are returned.
inputs.day: number – optional – Day (1-31) to filter holidays. If provided with month, only holidays on that specific date are returned.

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error, if any
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error (API_KEY_MISSING, API_KEY_INVALID, INVALID_COUNTRY, INVALID_YEAR, API_ERROR, RATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.country_code: string – ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code used
outputs.year: number – year for which holidays were retrieved
outputs.holidays: array – list of holidays, each containing: name (string), date (string YYYY-MM-DD), datetime (string ISO format), type (array of strings like ['National holiday', 'Observance']), description (string), country (string), locations (string)
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors
